boardgame.name: We Are All Mad Here
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Jack climbing the beanstalk. The little mermaid finding her voice. Alice struggling with the madness of a place unruled by the laws of reality. The queen. The child. The woodsman. The knight. When you think about fairy tales, who do you become? Where does your imagination take you?

Fairy tales tap into myth and archetype, exploring the fundamental nature of the mind and of human experience. They’re filled with magic that’s big, bold, unexpected, and wondrous—and characters who, despite humble roots or broken foundations, achieve feats just as grand.

Run one-shots based on traditional stories or those of your own devising. Or build entire campaigns that take the fairy tale concept in whole new directions.

boardgame.name: Super Power System Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This updated Super Power System Core Rulebook replaces the first edition Roleplaying Guide and the Character Guide (The Setting Guide still has lots of unique information not included in here). It takes all the rules updates from those two books, plus a plethora of new updates and modifications and crams them into a 300+ page tome of rules.

Beyond that, it also has a LOT of additions, including:


New Powers - over a dozen new powers!
New Abilities - Psionic, Magic, Leadership
New Gear & Equipment
New Rules & Options for Combat
Updated Character Creation styles and options
Fan-Requested Rules & Updates!
New Layout & Color Designs

boardgame.name: Setting Guide Super Power System
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You’ve got the Super Power System - Roleplaying Guide, and now you want to expand your action!

This add-on volume adds in-depth details on a custom setting for your characters to play in! Learn about the world of the Super Power System! This book includes the history of this Alternate Earth, with maps, major city details, hero team dossiers, and biographies for dozens of custom heroes & villains! Still not enough? Get Artifacts, Lost Lands, Alien Races, and more!

Get more out of your Super Power System!

boardgame.name: Character Guide Super Power System
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You’ve got the Super Power System - Roleplaying Guide, and now you want to expand your action!

This add-on volume adds examples and in-depth explanations for character creation and leveling up. It also has custom NPC characters for your adventures, character blocks for NPC’s, and more! Also included are the NEW Leadership Abilities based off of your Social Block skills for higher-level characters and leaders of Super Teams! Still not enough? Check out the pre-made Magic Abilities, Psionic Abilities, and our collection of Gear! Use ours or make your own to further customize your super characters!

Get more out of your Super Power System!

boardgame.name: Roleplaying Guide Super Power System
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Craving some comic book action? Look up in the sky! Actually, don’t… Look inside this book instead!This book has a Custom Roleplaying System that new players and veterans of other systems alike can quickly pick up. It has a proprietary system that focuses on a set of 12 Character Stats and a Resistances instead of proficiencies and a lot of bothersome skills.

This is built for storytellers who like having a LOT of different options.Included in this book is a set of full rules, details for nearly 200 Powers & Abilities, 50 Weaknesses, and all the rules you need for Magic, Psionics, and Combat!Take your character from level 1 to 20, growing in power and refining your super powers as you go!

Enjoy role-playing with an extremely extensive set of powers and weaknesses, giving you the options to make just about any character you can imagine or to emulate just about any character ever seen in any comic universe!

boardgame.name: Mayhem in the Motor City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need some missions and adventures for your heroes in the world of the Super Power System?

Here you go with our first Action Pack!

Get all the following in this 54 page volume:


2 ready-made player characters
2 game-ready NPCs from the Setting Guide
5 encounters with maps, instructions, XP suggestions, and custom NPCs
Detailed maps of the encounters


Enjoy these adventures as a hero or a villain.

boardgame.name: Song of the Nehmet
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a fan-made fantasy adventure module for 5th edition or other d20-based roleplaying system. It contains 7 pre-made characters with unique skills and abilities, 7 custom bad guys with evil beasts of their own, the setting and storyline, plus all of the maps and floor plans of major buildings you will need to carry out all 3 acts of the story. It offers storyline arcs and options in exhaustive detail! It also has additional story ideas and maps if you want to stretch this adventure into a campaign.

The plot is laid out in 3 acts, with a starting point for each character. Events occur to generally push the players together, but this worked great with starting players, giving them a chance to learn their character's specific abilities and work out their motivations.

As characters come together and the story progresses, the book offers DM advice and potential solutions for different likely strategies character groups may attempt. It's a branching plot that will eventually push players toward a final throwdown with the big bad guys of the story.

It's a great dark fantasy adventure for a group of 3-7 players. I like to keep 1 of the characters for myself as an NPC to sort of guide the adventure. Had a great game with novice to experienced players. It can be a marathon session or split over a few nights.

It's important to note that each character is premade with a set of unique powers that don't usually come in any kit or class. They have strong bonuses, but also harsh weaknesses that make them very fun and interesting to play. For example, an archer with amazing called shot and critical shot bonuses, but arthritic hands that quickly become a detriment to fighting drawn out battles. Or, a beefy barbarian shapeshifter that can only shapeshift into cuddly creatures. Try to save the day with that!

boardgame.name: Phoenix Command King Tiger: World War II Heavy Tanks
boardgame.description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


This supplement to the Phoenix Command Mechanized Combat System provides the Status Sheets for the primary Heavy Tanks of World War II. Included are the German Pz VI Tiger, the Pz VI King Tiger, the Soviet KV1 with 76mm gun, the "Speedy" KV1S, the KV-85 with 85mm gun, the Joseph Stalin IS2 and IS2m Heavy Tanks with 122mm guns, and the US M4A3E2 "Jumbo" Assault Sherman.In addition, special rules for Vehicle Systems specific to World War II Tanks and Second Shot Accuracy are presented, along with full Vehicle Descriptions.

-from the back of the book

boardgame.name: Phoenix Command: Mechanized Light Vehicles
boardgame.description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


This Suplement to the Phoenix Command: Mechanized Combat System that covers primary Light Fighting Vehicles.

boardgame.name: Phoenix Command: Mechanized Combat System
boardgame.description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


The Phoenix Command: Mechanized combines a detailed, accurate simulation of modern tank combat with quick, simple game mechanics to create a system that gives the player a fast playing game of unbeatable realism.

boardgame.name: Phoenix Command: Russian Roulette – The Breakup of the Soviet Union
boardgame.description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


From the Baltic Republics to the Black Sea to the barricades in Moscow, Russian Roulette takes players to the scenes of the critical military events that led to the vast changes underway in the Soviet Union. Six historical and hypothetical battles are presented in this Scenario Pack, including:Soviet Intervention in Baku: When ethnic strife between Armenians and Azerbaijanis went out of control in early 1990, Soviet troops were called in to bring order to Baku, Azerbaijan's capital. This Scenario is a night street battle between Soviets and a crowd of well-armed Demonstrators.

Crackdown in Latvia: In January of 1991, the Soviets sent troops into seven different Republics in an attempt to end nationalist movements. In this Scenario, Soviet Special Forces fight Latvian police for control of the Interior Ministry building, in a battle that was televised internationally.

Other Scenarios cover Black Berets in Lithuania, Vigilantes in Azerbaijan, and Ethnic Strife in Georgia. There is even a Scenario for what might have happened if the Soviet military had tried to kill Boris Yeltsin during August's failed Coup. Each Scenario includes a detailed Map, special rules, and full data for all the combatants. Also included is background material for each of the Scenarios, plus an overview of the Soviet military and security forces.

-from the back cover

boardgame.name: Phoenix Command: Mechanized Pak Front – World War II Anti-Tank Guns
boardgame.description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


This supplement to the Phoenix Command Mechanized Combat System provides the Weapon Data for the primary Anti-Tank Guns of World War II.Included are the 24 most prominent Anti-Tank Guns of the war, from the German 37mm Pak 36 to the devastating 88mm Pak 43, and from the British 2 Pounder to the US M5 3 Inch Gun and the Soviet 100mm D-10. Full descriptions of each Gun are also given, as are the special rules for using World War II Anti-Tank Guns.

-from the back of the book

boardgame.name: Phoenix Command: Mechanized Panzer – World War II Medium Tanks
boardgame.description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


This supplement to the Phoenix Command Mechanized Combat System provides the Status Sheets for the primary Medium Tanks of World War II. Included are versions of the German Pz IV, including the short-barreled Pz IV-F1, the long-barreled Pz IV-F2, and the high-velocity Pz IV-H; two models of the powerful Pz V Panther; the Soviet T34 and the T34 / 85; and the US M4A3 Sherman with both 75mm gun and high-velocity 76mm gun.In addition, special rules for Vehicle Systems specific to World War II Tanks and Second Shot Accuracy are presented, along with full Vehicle Descriptions.

-from the back of the book

boardgame.name: Phoenix Command: Special Weapons Weapon Data Supplement
boardgame.description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


This Special Weapons Supplement to the Phoenix Command Combat System contains all the necessary rules and data for a wide variety of unusual or distinctive weapon systems, included are:- Riot Control Gear, from Tear Gas to Plastic Bullets
- Protest Weapons, from Rocks and Bottles to Molotov Cocktails
- Incendiary Weapons, from White Phosphorus Grenades to World War II and Modern Flamethrowers
- Modern Military Equipment, from Claymore Mines to Miniguns
- Archery Equipment, from the Horsebow of ancient times to the modern Compound Target Bow
- Weapons of Stealth, from Silencers for Sub-machineguns and Pistols to Garrotes and Strangulation Techniques

This supplement allows Phoenix Command players to incorporate a wide variety of powerful, unusual, or highly specialized weapons into their gaming.

-from the back cover

boardgame.name: Phoenix Command: World War II Weapon Data Supplement
boardgame.description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


Now the Phoenix Command Small Arms Combat System lets you join the battles of World War II, with more than 80 of the most memorable weapons used during the conflict. All the major powers are represented: France, Germany, Great Britain, Italy, Japan, the Soviet Union, and the United States. Included are:- Pistols, from the Japanese 8mm Taisho 14 to the British Webley Mk6 .455 Revolver
- Sub-Machine Guns, from the German MP38/40 Schmeisser to the Allied Sten Mk2 and Mk3, and the famous Thompson "Tommygun"
- Bolt Action and Semi-Automatic Rifles, from the U.S. Ml Garand to the German KAR 98K
- Machine Guns, from the British Vickers Mkl to the German MG42 7.92mm Mauser
- Explosives, from the German Stick Grenade to the U.S. "Pineapple" Grenade

Fully illustrated, this supplement allows Phoenix Command players to include World War II and many post-war conflicts in their gaming.
-from the back cover

boardgame.name: Phoenix Command: Wild West Weapon Data Supplement
boardgame.description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


Now the Phoenix Command Small Arms Combat System lets you ride with the soldiers and gunslingers of the American Frontier. This supplement features 48 of the most popular and memorable weapons of the West, as well as special rules for the classic shootouts of legend. Included are:- Pistols, from the Derringer to the Colt Peacemaker
- Muskets, from the Charleville to the Springfield 1863
- Breechloading Rifles, from the Sharps Carbine to the Springfield 1873
- Lever Action Rifles, from the Henry Repeater to the Winchester 1873
- Other Weapons, including the Sawed-Off Shotgun and the Gatling Gun

Also included are sections on Quick Drawing, Fanning Revolvers, Speed Loading, and rules for Firing From (and Firing At) Horses, as well as an overview of weapons development through the nineteenth century.

Fully illustrated, this supplement allows Phoenix Command players to include the Napoleonic Era, the Civil War, and the days of the American Frontier in their gaming.

-from the back cover

boardgame.name: Flames of War: Bloody Omaha – Ace Campaign
boardgame.description:
Bloody Omaha is the first in a series of Ace Campaigns, a narrative-driven system of Flames Of War battles.
Ace Campaigns are extremely flexible in allowing players to tailor their campaign to fit their playgroups needs.
There are three different modes that you can play the campaign in:

Story Mode,
Extended Mode, and
Aces Mode.


Story mode is your shortest campaign that only uses the Story and Reward cards, while Extended allows you to play longer campaigns by adding in side missions.
The Aces mode can be used with Story Mode or Extended Mode an allows players to create their own unique commander with special abilities that will give them an edge during the course of the campaign.

Contains 18 Story Cards, ten Side Mission Cards, 16 Ace Cards, 20 Reward Cards and one Ace Campaign Rule booklet.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

boardgame.name: Sins of the Past
boardgame.description:
"Few brave souls dare to visit the City of the Dead at night. Some might say that tales of nighttime horrors are for children, but the wise folk know better"

Three members of the Jackals gang, a famous grave robbers, are found murdered in the City of the Dead cemetery in Waterdeep. Their wounds are horrible, and their jaws are completely destroyed.

City Watch is looking for heroes who are willing to stand up for their city and investigate this murder which has a clear supernatural influence.

Sins of the Past is a 3-4 hour urban adventure of mystery and horror. It is optimized for 4 or 5 characters of 3rd level.

This adventure can be used as a faction mission for Waterdeep: Dragon Heist as well as a standalone one-shot.

Sins of the Past features:

- Investigation of a mysterious murder, which leads to uncovering one of Waterdeep’s families dark secret
- Old family mausoleum full of dangers and secrets
- Famous Mirror of Life Trapping with enemies trapped inside, which adventurers should face
- Encounters with various undead creatures like will-o-wisps, zombies, specters, and ghosts
- Moral dilemma characters should solve and two possible outcomes

boardgame.name: Alt254
boardgame.description:
One Pixel, One Journey:

Alt254 is a minimalistic open-world adventure & action game where… YOU ARE A PIXEL ■

Embark on a fascinating journey and discover how every pixel will impact your experience during the game. Exploring new areas, deciphering mysteries and defeating enemies will be essential in a game with one of the minor resolutions you have ever played!

Exploring new areas
A fully pixelated world awaits to be discovered during your adventure. Explore the different locations and use each of the mechanics that complete the game to progress on your journey. There is no one way to move forward, so it is up to you how to enjoy this experience through the vast world of Alt254.

Deciphering mysteries

Complement the journey you will enjoy thanks to Alt254 with the many mysteries scattered throughout its open world. Some will appear hidden behind cryptic messages, but in other cases you will have to scan every pixel on the map to find them. There are also those who say that the terrain around you has some secret…

Defeating enemies

The world of Alt254 will not only be full of mysteries and puzzles to solve, but it will also be populated with mysterious creatures. Despite the fact that its origin is not very clear, it is evident that they will not facilitate your journey and will impede your progress as much as possible. Defeat them with the quirky combat system and don’t let them intrude on your experience.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: TRISTOY
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A 2D co-op platformer that has to be played 2 player.

boardgame.name: Cave Coaster
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Control your minecart through caves to get as much treasure as possible to allow you to upgrade your minecart and do it again.

boardgame.name: Grafito
boardgame.description:
The four elements of hip hop are deejaying, rapping, break dancing, and graffiti painting, and these elements inspired Grafito, a rondel-based game about street art in the modern cities. Each player takes on a role of a graffiti artist, and you need to pick paints, and combine and use them to create great panels with your signature. Are you ready to control the walls of the street?

To set up, place eight paint cubes in each of the four rondels of the main game board; each rondel looks like an old-school LP record divided into eight colored sections. Use only primary paint cubes (blue, red, yellow and white) for now, then place the wall board next to the main board. Take an individual player board to organize your components, then shuffle the mural cards and reveal four face up.

On a turn, collect paint cubes or use a mural card to occupy a place on the wall board. By scratching the LPs — that is, turning the rondels — you can collect paint. You can rotate a rondel one space for free or spend workers to move more spaces or a second rondel; by matching colors across LPs, you can collect paint. By discarding a worker, you can use Basquiat's Lessons to duplicate paint cubes in your bag, change their colors, or obtain secondary colors.

Once you have the necessary components, you can complete a mural card by discarding the paint cubes required, possibly creating secondary colors along the way by discarding primary cubes. You receive points for these cards at the end of the game, and these cards depict different elements of hip hop, with you scoring bonuses from bonds of matching elements on the wall board.

When the wall board is finished, the game ends, and whoever has the most points becomes King of the Wall!

boardgame.name: Rise of the Democracy
boardgame.description:
Rise of the Democracy is set in the Bot War universe immediately after the first Atlantican War. The game is designed primarily around themed and narrative play. It is a stand-alone game but is also ideal for complimenting narrative campaigns alongside Bot War. Rise of the Democracy is a 2-player game, although you can also play the game in teams if you wish.

The game is scenario based with some scenarios presenting asymmetrical objectives to both sides.

Both players choose a force up to a pre-determined points cost

The focus is on squad combat with 'Hero' models adding flavor to the squads.

boardgame.name: Spukstaben
boardgame.description:
Spukstaben is a co-operative word game for one to four players.

In the game, the players work at an old-school letterpress printshop where hordes of little ghosts appear at night to steal their precious type blocks. These ghosts are called "Spukstaben", a portmanteau of the German words "Spuk" (a spooky commotion) and "Buchstaben" (letters). The players have to come up with words to defeat the ghosts and save their letters. The more type blocks they save, the more points they score at the end of the game.

The game is played over ten rounds during which new Spukstaben appear with stolen type blocks, then move towards the exit of the printshop — although some ghosts will jump towards the door immediately. Whenever a Spukstabe enters the game, its level of spook-energy is set based on the number of players.

During each round, the players have one minute to separately come up with one word each that contains as many of the stolen letters as possible. These letters then hit the ghosts and reduce their spook-energy by one. However, each letter of a word can hit only one ghost and each word can hit a ghost only once, so the players have to work together to defeat the Spukstaben.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Cube-x³
Quader
boardgame.description:
A strategic game for 2 people.

A richly varied three-dimensional game in which the players have to try to build geometric combinations with two-tone double blocks and at the same time tactically thwart the opponent's plans. Since a cuboid with the color of the opponent is automatically placed with each move, there are almost unlimited possibilities of combinations. For the first two moves in game 1 alone 1.400!
There are 5 different ways to play:
1. game: Three blocks of the same color in a horizontal, vertical or diagonal combination of three.
2. game: Four squares of the same color in a vertical, horizontal or vertex combination of four.
3. game: Several horizontal, vertical or diagonal three-way combinations.
4. game: Several cuboids of the same color in a vertical, horizontal or vertex-combination of four.
5. game: Several vertical, horizontal and diagonal three-way combinations like game 1 and several vertical, horizontal and upside-down four-way combinations like game 4.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Behind the Claw
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb from their website:

Behind the Claw presents two complete sectors of Imperial space; Deneb and the Spinward Marches. Deneb is bordered by the Vargr Extents and the Great Rift, and has traditionally seen fierce rivalry between its powerful dukes. A long history of compromises and temporary deals has created a fragmented political situation ripe for exploitation by those with the wit and the will… and there is always the threat of corsairs from over the border.

The Spinward Marches is a border region, caught between the Aslan Hierate and Zhodani Consulate, with the tumultuous politics of Deneb at its back. It is the gateway to the Imperial frontiers and the crossroads of internal and external politics. Adventure opportunities abound between the frontier worlds of the Marches and the trade hubs of Deneb. Far from the Imperial Core, fortune awaits the bold and disaster lurks for the unwary Traveller.

Includes a huge double-sided poster map of both the Spinward Marches and Deneb sectors.

boardgame.name: Mean Streets Tiles
boardgame.description:
From the website:

Paved with good intentions...

This set of 12 double-sided terrain cards (plus bonus terrain inside the covers) features a selection of downtown locations that could be the setting for all sorts of modern-day urban encounters. Design your own streets and alley layout, and add a small restaurant or studio apartment. Mix and match the tiles to create your own downtown locale, or use the cover cards as a guide.

Each card measures 5 by 8 inches, and is printed on thick glossy cover stock. The complete printed set is gathered in a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transportation.

From the cover cards:

12 Double-Sided Terrain Cards
Set includes: Twelve 5x8-inch double sided map cards.
Bonus bus stop and sidewalk with tree tiles on the back of the cover cards.

boardgame.name: Night Life
boardgame.description:
From the Website:

The day may be done, but the party is just beginning!

This set of 12 double-sided terrain cards (plus bonus terrain behind each cover) is designed to let you create and customize your own urban adventure locations, including seedy taverns, posh restaurants, ritzy casinos, or even sultry strip clubs--whatever you need for the evening's adventures!

Each card measures 5 by 8 inches, and is printed on thick glossy cover stock. The complete set is gathered in a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transportation.

From the cover cards:

12 Double-Sided Terrain Cards
Set includes: Twelve 5x8-inch double-sided map cards.
Two more bonus tiles inside the covers.
Fine, colored terrain lines for miniatures play on a 1-inch grid.

boardgame.name: Space Dinos
boardgame.description:
Boldly going where no Dinos had gone before...

During their mission to explore strange new worlds, the Space
Dinos found a new home after the fall of their kind on earth. They continued their pursuit of exploration, tracking Stardust and building constellations that grace the night sky. Space has become their final adventure. Join them in their continuing voyage to build constellations as they explore through space.

Earn the most star points while placing constellation tiles in the galaxy. Constellation tiles may not be placed directly next to tiles of similar design (color or number of stars).

Constellations are available in 6 colors with 1 of each tile containing 1-6 stars. Tiles must be placed making a grid that is 6x6 tiles. Dinos exploring constellations and creating pleasing constellation sets earn star points allowing them to travel through the galaxy. Several game play missions are available and dictate new player objectives and are detailed in those missions.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dimensional Timeship Tiles
boardgame.description:
From the Website:

Explore the multiverse, one reality at a time...

This set of 12 double-sided terrain cards (plus an Alternate Control Chamber on the back of the two cover cards) provides everything you need to build your own futuristic vessel with which to travel all of space and time. Mix and match the tiles to create countless variations, and rearrange them as needed to transform the ship dynamically in the middle of an adventure.

Pick up two sets and use both sides at once to double the passenger space, display two completely different ships at the same time, or turn your Timeship into a sprawling, ever-changing labyrinth where exploring or escaping the ship itself IS the adventure!

Each card measures 5 by 8 inches, and is printed on thick glossy cover stock. The printed set is gathered in a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transportation.

From the cover cards:

12 Double-Sided Terrain Cards
Set includes: Twelve 5x8-inch double-sided map cards.
Bonus "Alternate Control Chamber" tiles printed on the back of the cover cards.
Fine, colored terrain markings for miniature!

boardgame.name: Modular Starship Tiles
boardgame.description:
From the Website:
Customize your ship for the mission at hand...

This set of 12 double-sided terrain cards (plus two extras on the back of the two cover cards) provides everything you need to build your own cargo freighter, courier ship, or passenger liner. Mix and match the tiles to create countless variations, and rearrange them as needed to change the configuration of your own personal spacefaring vessel!

With two sets you can double the size of your deck plan, or display two completely different vehicles at the same time...

Each card measures 5 by 8 inches, and is printed on thick glossy cover stock. The complete set is gathered in a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transportation.

From the cover cards:

12 Double-Sided Terrain Cards
Set includes: Twelve 5x8-inch double-sided map cards.
Bonus Shuttle Bay and Cargo Pod tiles printed on the back of the cover cards.

boardgame.name: Mountain Tombs and Sunken Ruins
boardgame.description:
From the Website:

The deepest of places hide the darkest of secrets...

The dusty Mountain Tombs conceal the bones of ages past in carved stone halls, even as seaweed-choked ruins and ancient mysteries from faraway realms slumber in the depths of the Sunken Ruins.

This double-sided poster measures 22 by 34 inches, and is printed on glossy poster stock. It's pre-folded to 8.5 by 5.5 inches and packaged within a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transport.

Includes a free 5 by 8 inch terrain card that can be placed directly over the stonework bridge in the Mountain Tombs to remove it from the map--maybe that river's not such an easy thing to cross after all!

boardgame.name: Glacial Rift and Forest Glade
boardgame.description:
From the Website:
Danger lurks in even the most isolated of places...

Arctic winds howl through the frozen Glacial Rift as treacherous ice cracks beneath your feet, but the shadowy places of the seemingly-tranquil Forest Glade can hide creatures untold.

This double-sided poster measures 22 by 34 inches, and is printed on glossy poster stock. It's pre-folded to 8.5 by 5.5 inches and packaged within a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transport.

Includes a free 5 by 8 inch terrain card that can be placed over the Glacial Rift map to break the Icy Bridge and show pieces drifting away in the rush of water below!

boardgame.name: Seaport Docks and Sandy Shoreline
boardgame.description:
From the Website:
Adventure awaits where the land and sea are joined...

The Sandy Shoreline is a vacant stretch of coast where sailors might find themselves marooned, designed as a backdrop for miniatures and terrain! Meanwhile, the Seaport Docks depict the piers and warehouses of a feudal urban trading port!

This double-sided poster measures 22 by 34 inches, and is printed on glossy poster stock. It's pre-folded to 8.5 by 5.5 inches and packaged within a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transport.

Includes a free 5 by 8 inch terrain card featuring a dock and waterlogged boat; the card can be placed on top of the Sandy Shoreline map to add a new point of interest to the otherwise-deserted coast!

boardgame.name: Service Station and Ruined Service Station
boardgame.description:
Before and after portraits of a city on the edge of disaster...

The Service Station map depicts a bustling urban service plaza for travelers in need of repairs, refreshments, recreation, or refueling. The Ruined Service Station, on the other side, shows the same location abandoned in the aftermath of a society-crumbling disaster or apocalypse!

This double-sided poster measures 22 by 34 inches, and is printed on glossy poster stock. It's pre-folded to 8.5 by 5.5 inches and packaged within a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transport.

Includes a free 5 by 8 inch terrain card featuring a blast crater that can be placed on the ruined parking lot to transform the environment during an encounter.

boardgame.name: Command Deck and Security Deck
boardgame.description:
From the website:

All hands to battle stations!

The Battle Stations maps introduce you to a military staging area in multiple levels! The corridors and elevator shafts line up to create either a sprawling or a multi-tiered epic gaming environment that recreates the decks of a massive starship, space station, or base facility!

The Command Deck provides operational support and advanced weapons stations along with a hangar for prototype star-bomber development, while the Security Deck offers weapons emplacements, flight control, and a staging area for the deployment of starfighter defenses.

This double-sided poster measures 22 by 34 inches, and is printed on glossy poster stock. It's pre-folded to 8.5 by 5.5 inches and packaged within a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transport.

Includes a free 5 by 7 inch terrain card featuring an alternate configuration for the energy doors on the Command Deck.

boardgame.name: Hanger Deck and Simulation Deck
boardgame.description:
From the website:
Prepare for Battle!

These maps expand the Battle Station to include the lower deck of the hangar bay that was viewed from above in the Security Deck, and a vast training facility designed to test the mettle of commando squads. Stage a "capture the flag" scenario or infiltrate the base using the cargo hauler docked in the hangar!

This double-sided poster measures 22 by 34 inches, and is printed on glossy poster stock. It's pre-folded to 8.5 by 5.5 inches and packaged within a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transport.

Includes a free 5 by 7 inch terrain card featuring an empty cargo bay for the ship, PLUS three bonus, double-sided, 5 by 8 inch terrain cards that reveal the upper deck and outside hull of the cargo hauler, allowing the action to move from level to level within and around the ship in the hangar bay!

boardgame.name: Observation Deck and Mobilization Deck
boardgame.description:
From the website:

Prepare for Battle!

These maps expand the Battle Station facility to include the senior command center and control nexus overlooking the special ops decks below, and the primary deployment hangar from which elite military squads are launched.

This double-sided poster measures 22 by 34 inches, and is printed on glossy poster stock. It's pre-folded to 8.5 by 5.5 inches and packaged within a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transport.

Includes a free 5 by 7 inch terrain card that can be placed over the Observation Deck to blast out several windows and shower the area with broken glass!

boardgame.name: Garrison Deck and Supply Deck
boardgame.description:
From the website:

Prepare for Battle!

These maps expand the Battle Station facility to reveal the barracks, armory, and weapon testing range of an elite military force, and the service depot that delivers equipment and other provisions to the base from below.

The Supply Deck also connects seamlessly via a railway line to the Mass Transit series, allowing both sets of poster maps to combine into one massive sci-fi installation!

This double-sided poster measures 22 by 34 inches, and is printed on glossy poster stock. It's pre-folded to 8.5 by 5.5 inches and packaged within a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transport.

Includes a free 5 by 7 inch terrain card that can be placed over the Garrison Deck to retract the bridge docking to the armored transport vehicle from the north side!

boardgame.name: Armored Cartographers: Great Library and Starport District
boardgame.description:
From the Website:

Gaming maps designed and illustrated for the Adventurers Atlas (no longer operating). The Armored Cartographers product line features 34×22″ maps with sci-fi settings, perfect for Star Wars roleplaying or miniatures gaming.

The layout of each map has a significant impact on gameplay, so all designs required extensive playtesting before illustration could begin, to ensure both the art and the gameplay experience were the highest quality.

boardgame.name: Crash Octopus
거대문어소동
boardgame.description:
"We lost our way and sailed into a nightmare. All our cargo was thrown overboard, and now we must save that precious cargo — as well as our captain! — and escape from the raging gigantic octopus from the deep."

In Crash Octopus, players race to collect cargo that's floating in the ocean, while surrounded by a horrifically giant octopus. The first player who collects all five types of cargo on their ship wins.

The game is played by using the table as the landscape, with a string perimeter around the playing area. To set up, place the octopus head at the center of the playing area, surrounded by the tentacles spread out at an equal distance, then the player ships and anchors outside of the tentacles near the perimeter. Finally, you drop all the cargo onto the playing area by bouncing it off the octopus' head.

On a turn, a player uses their flag to either navigate — by flicking the anchor next to their ship, then moving their ship to touch the anchor — or flick cargo. Cargo comes in five types — goblet, chest, gem, gold, and captain (yes, really!) — and you can flick any type of cargo that's not on your ship toward your ship. The only exception is that you can't flick the single cargo item closest to your ship. If the flicked cargo misses your ship, your turn ends; if it hits your ship, you load that cargo, then advance the cargo tracker, which is a string of beads on the perimeter.

If you advance a black bead on the cargo tracker, the octopus attacks! Each player takes a turn dropping a die and bouncing it off the octopus' head, possibly moving the head or a tentacle to get in the way of others picking up cargo and possibly knocking cargo off a ship. What a setback!

boardgame.description: Genuine 3D bowling where you swing the Joy-Con Controller to bowl! -(from the Nintendo Switch eShop)

boardgame.name: Wanderlust: Travel Card Game
boardgame.description:
Do you love to travel? Do you like planning your vacations? Or you enjoy relaxing getaways. Wanderlust is a card game for everyone. Get a taste of travelling to different countries, explore what each place has to offer and make friends. Win rewards for exploring, planning or simply being the most fun person.

The Wanderlust card game starts like all card games – cards are shuffled and distributed between all the players. The rules mention different numbers of cards which are to be distributed to the players if different numbers of players are playing.

After the cards are distributed — the main objective of the game, making sets starts guiding the players. The unique thing about Wanderlust is the close connect between the story and the game mechanism. Sets need to made — but why, which and most importantly how?

The game has four type of cards. Destination cards, Currency cards, Journey cards and Reward cards. Each of the sets (Explorer, Planner and Fun Person) has a certain sequence of cards specified. This sequence is a mix of Destination and Currency cards or only one of these two kinds of cards.

In the game players collect Currency cards and trade Journey cards to get different Destination and Currency cards. This way different kinds of sets are made and Reward cards are won. The number of sets to be made is finite. The game is over when the Reward cards are over or if the game play gets stuck.

It contains 52 high quality cards and 1 easy-to-understand manual.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Quem Vai?
boardgame.description:
Find who will go in this fast and fun game.

Quem Vai? (Portuguese for "Who go") is an accessory game that will help you make the most important decisions of your life!

Know that super nice game that you will play in 2 minutes? Who will be the first player? Use Quem Vai? to decide this and other things:

Who will order the pizza?
Who will do the dishes?
Who will get the last piece of cake?
Who will make popcorn?

Quem Vai? is fast and simple: simply shuffle the cards, pull one of them and done: you already have a criteria as to use to make the decisions about who will do something.

The game is quick and fits for two up to whoever many players are deciding.

Use Quem Vai? to decide the most important things in your life.

boardgame.name: Massive Darkness: Feldherr Foam Tray Set
boardgame.description:
With this set you store all figures and material of the Original Massive Darkness board game. All miniatures and the whole equipment have tailored cut-outs in the foams. So you can protect and sort all the game material. On the basis of space-saving positioned compartments you have space for six additional units. Foam extends over the edge of the board game boxes.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cuddly Cockroaches
boardgame.description:
Cuddly Cockroaches is a player elimination tabletop card game, inspired by the game maker’s real-life cockroach infestation that happened during the quarantine of Spring of 2020.

In Cuddly Cockroaches, players are neighbors in an apartment building with a Cockroach problem. Every turn starts with more cockroaches getting added to the game. Some cockroaches have special abilities that make them more desirable roommates - but they are also worth more points. The goal is to be the last apartment standing with less than ten roach points.

During a turn, players can use their cockroaches to infest their neighbors' apartments or play supply cards like bug spray or Exterminator to kill their roaches and send them to the basement. If a player has more than ten roach points at the end of their turn, they’ve lost the game! Losers turn over the apartment mat to reveal they’ve been fumigated, and their roaches scurry off to remaining apartments. The last apartment standing wins!

Infesting is the central mechanic in Cuddly Cockroaches. To infest, players pick a target neighbor, select any number of roaches from their apartment to infest with, and roll a die. To successfully infest, the dice roll has to be higher than the total value of roach points they’re infesting with. If successful, those roaches get sent to the target neighbor’s apartment. Roll equal or lower than the point value of roaches chosen for an infestation, and those roaches stay in the player’s apartment. Either way, the player attempting the infestation gets to draw a supply card.

Infesting challenges players to gauge their odds as they gamble to get rid of roaches. Bet conservatively, and risk the chance of getting fumigated before your neighbors over time. Take too much of a gamble, and risk never getting rid of your roaches. Supply cards can pass roaches from your apartment to your neighbors, add points to your dice roll or actions to your turn, or kill roaches and send them to the basement. But the only way to draw supply cards is by infesting, so players are rewarded for playing aggressively. Players get two actions per turn, any combo of infesting, playing a supply card, and shuffling their hand into the deck, and drawing three. Just like a real-life roach infestation, it’s a losing battle of bugs - but a lucky roll can be a game-changer!

Be a good neighbor, and share your roaches!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Micro Dojo
boardgame.description:
In Micro Dojo, you represent one of two Daimyos who have been tasked by the Shogun to bring prosperity to a small town. Carefully use the town’s retainers to complete the Shogun’s tasks and win favour. The most prosperous Daimyo will be granted the title to the town.

Micro Dojo is a 20 min tactical euro game for two players, intended to fit comfortably in a pocket or purse. In Micro Dojo, players take control of the Ninja, Samurai, Sumo and Geisha meeples to generate resources, develop the town, and score points by achieving the Shogun’s tasks.

Each turn players move one of the four meeples to an adjacent space and take the action there - either gathering resources, taking a building, or activating a scoring objective. The catch? You can't move the last meeple either you or your opponent moved. The games end when the last objective is triggered, or a player reaches 7 points.

Movement is tight, requiring you to second guess your opponents plan. Timing is crucial, triggering objective scoring only when it benefits you. Like a sparring match, every move should be chosen with precision and efficiency, or your opponent will strike.

boardgame.name: Pizzeria
피자의 달인
boardgame.description:
You and your friends go to a pizzeria for lunch. Each round you order a new pizza, and a different player slices the pizza into portions. Pizzas consist of different kinds of slices and you have to split it in the best possible way. Some people like pepperoni, others want vegetarian or supreme… How should you cut it, so the portion you want the most gets to you?

In order to get the points, you have to collect the most slices of the given type. You may also choose to eat slices instead of collecting them. Then you get points for basil leaves that were on the slices you ate. The player with the most points is the winner.

Pizzeria is the new edition of …aber bitte mit Sahne/New York Slice prepared by Nasza Księgarnia.
The biggest rules differences are:

a new type of pizza – Pomodoro
solo variant
no anchovies

boardgame.name: Pop-A-Plane
boardgame.description:
Pop-A-Plane is a promotional Australian board game produced by Maize Products Pty Ltd during the Second World War.
The object of the game is for players to shoot down opposing aircraft. To achieve this a player aims a movable metal field gun at a numbered plane and calls the numbered plane. Then the player rolls the dice. If the number on the dice matches the number on the selected plane then the plane is shot down. If there is no match the other player takes their turn.
The winner is the player who shoots down all the opposing enemy aircraft.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Mental Morris
boardgame.description:
Mental Morris is a two player abstract played entirely in the mind. It is however played on a mental board of 3x3 squares with three pieces each. The object is the game is to form a straight line of your pieces, either diagonally or orthogonally. If a player makes an illegal move, the opponent wins.

The board is numbered from top to bottom like a num pad. 1,2,3 on top, 4,5,6 on the next row and 7,8,9 on the final row.

Players initially place their three pieces on free squares by calling out the number of the square where they want their piece to be. After that players call out moves by naming the square of the piece they want to move, and then the square they want their piece to move to. Say it as one number, i.e. "fifty eight", (58). Pieces may move only one space in an orthogonal direction. Pieces may not share a square, and jumping over pieces is not allowed.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Astro Antics
boardgame.description:
Astro Antics is a space race board game produced in 1961. The game is a simple roll and move of pieces that resemble Mercury capsules of the era.
The object of the game is to be the first to make one full orbit of the earth and return safely. A player can get trapped into a circular path around a spiral Nebula which will delay their progress. Two sets of cards "Orbit Chances" and "Emergency Instructions" are in the game and players must obey the directions if instructed to do so. Some of the instructions like make an ugly face or sing a song are supposed to add fun to the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Dingo Disc
boardgame.description:
A game of skill, balance, strategy and skill where players must place all their counters on a balanced disk without dropping the counters which have already been placed.

Each player, in turn, rolls both dice. The colour die determines the coloured area of the disk; the 6 die indicates the location to place the counter.

The winner is the player who places all his counters first. Any player who spills all the counters off the disk automatically loses.
